conclusion: Analyze the circuit to understand component interaction when the switch is open or closed.
Circuit with a battery, two resistors (10 Ω and 20 Ω), a switch (S), and a voltmeter connected between points a and b.
When switch S is open, voltmeter reads 6V, indicating the battery voltage is 6V.
When switch is closed, circuit forms a loop with battery, resistors, and voltmeter; voltmeter still reads 6V.
Total resistance in loop is 30 Ω (sum of 10 Ω and 20 Ω resistors).
Voltage between points a and b calculated using Ohm's law: V = I × R.
Circuit behaves as if short-circuited; voltage drop across resistors negligible, voltage between a and b remains 6V.
